title: Disengagement 75% Complete: S Jaishankar On "Progress" Along LAC With China
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said today that there has been "some progress" with China on the boundary issue. The minister said that approximately 75 per cent of the "disengagement" problems has been resolved.
summary: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said today that there has been "some progress" with China on the boundary issue. The minister said that approximately 75 per cent of the "disengagement" problems has been resolved.

title: Miss Switzerland Finalist Killed By Husband, 'Pureed' In Blender: Officials
content: The 38-year-old former model was discovered dead on February 13 in the laundry room of her home in Binningen.

title: 23 Years Of 9/11 Attacks: How A New Approach Is Needed To Fight Terrorism
content: An effective definition of terrorism is necessary to provide the operational rules of engagement to national security agencies.

title: Ex-CIA Agent, Who Spied For China, Jailed For 10 Years
content: A former Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) officer, was sentenced to 10 years in prison for spying for the Chinese government.

title: Why Netanyahu Chooses War Over Peace
content: As protests grow, Benjamin Netanyahu clings to power in what appears to be a gambit to shape his own political and legal future, regardless of the cost.

title: US Man Charged For Secretly Drugging And Assaulting Women He Met Online
content: A 40-year-old New York resident is facing serious charges after allegedly drugging and sexually assaulting women he met through an online sugar daddy' website.

title: Van Gogh's 'Sunflowers' Series Exhibited Side By Side In London Show
content: A hundred years after acquiring one of Vincent van Gogh's "Sunflowers", Britain's National Gallery in London will bring his vision to life by showcasing three works side-by-side for the first time.
summary: A hundred years after acquiring one of Vincent van Gogh's "Sunflowers", Britain's National Gallery in London will bring his vision to life by showcasing three works side-by-side for the first time.

title: Indian-Origin Israeli Soldier Killed In Car Attack In West Bank
content: A 24-year-old Indian-origin Israeli soldier from the Bnei Menashe community was killed in a vehicle-ramming attack close to the West Bank's Beit El settlement, community members said on Thursday.
summary: A 24-year-old Indian-origin Israeli soldier from the Bnei Menashe community was killed in a vehicle-ramming attack close to the West Bank's Beit El settlement, community members said on Thursday.

title: Jon Bon Jovi Saw A Woman Trying To Jump Off A Bridge. What Happened Next
content: Singer Jon Bon Jovi and his team were on a bridge in Tennessee when they saw a woman holding onto the railing while standing on the ledge.

title: SpaceX Polaris Dawn Crew To Make History With First-Ever Private Spacewalk
content: After trekking deeper into space than any humans in the last half-century, a pioneering private crew is set to make history Thursday with the first-ever spacewalk by non-professional astronauts.
summary: After trekking deeper into space than any humans in the last half-century, a pioneering private crew is set to make history Thursday with the first-ever spacewalk by non-professional astronauts.

title: King Charles' Warm Hug With New Zealand Women's Rugby Team
content: King Charles shared a joyful moment with the New Zealand women's rugby union team at Buckingham Palace, where he exchanged hugs with the Black Ferns.
summary: King Charles shared a joyful moment with the New Zealand women's rugby union team at Buckingham Palace, where he exchanged hugs with the Black Ferns.

title: PricewaterhouseCoopers Fires 1,800 Employees In 1st Major Layoff Since 2009

title: Australian To Have New Privacy Laws To Prohibit Doxxing
content: The act of doxxing by releasing someone's personal information without consent will be made a criminal offence in Australia under new government privacy laws.

title: Surfer To 'Trump Whisperer': Who Can Become Japan's Next Prime Minister?

title: Opinion: 'Net ID' To New Books, Xi's Ideological Grip On China Is Tightening

title: Peru's Ex-President Alberto Fujimori Dies At 86
content: Peru's former president Alberto Fujimori, who ruled his country with an iron fist and then spent 16 years in prison for crimes against humanity, died on Wednesday at age 86 in the capital Lima.
summary: Peru's former president Alberto Fujimori, who ruled his country with an iron fist and then spent 16 years in prison for crimes against humanity, died on Wednesday at age 86 in the capital Lima.

title: Death Count Rises To 197 In Vietnam After Typhoon Yagi
content: The number of people killed after Typhoon Yagi swept through northern Vietnam bringing flash floods and landslides has risen to 197, the government said Thursday.

title: Harris, Trump Battle For Swing States After Fierce 1st Presidential Debate

title: Bill Gates Shares His No. 1 Concern That Keeps Him Up At Night
content: For Mr Gates, the key question during a future pandemic would be whether nations are better prepared than they were for the outbreak of Covid-19.
